entries.title: German Masters: Ali Carter beats Tom Ford - with a bit of help from Whitney Houston
entries.description: Ali Carter suggests that Whitney Houston inspired him to a first ranking title in seven years as he wins the German Masters.

entries.title: Epsom College head found dead with husband and daughter, 7
entries.description: Head of Epsom College found dead alongside husband and seven-year-old daughter in property on school grounds

entries.title: Grammy Awards 2023: Viola Davis becomes an EGOT
entries.description: The star is only the 18th person to win each of an Emmy, Grammy, Oscar and Tony Award.

entries.title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Kane, Rashford, Mitoma, Dawson, Tarkowski, Tete, Onana
entries.description: Who has been turbocharged by a new manager, and whose stunning display got Leicester back on track? It's Garth Crooks' Team of the Week.

entries.title: Gareth Bale in Pebble Beach Pro-Am: Ex-Wales footballer finishes in top 20
entries.description: Gareth Bale finishes in joint-16th at the Pebble Beach Pro-Am after missing out on the final round because of strong winds in California.

entries.title: West Ham United 0-0 Arsenal: Gunners falter in WSL title race
entries.description: Arsenal dropped points for the second successive Women's Super League match after being held to a goalless draw by West Ham United on Sunday evening.

entries.title: Pope and protestant leaders denounce anti-gay laws
entries.description: Pope Francis said laws which criminalise homosexuality were a sin and "an injustice".

entries.title: Six Nations highlights: Italy 24-29 France
entries.description: Watch the highlights as defending champions France come from behind to avoid a shock defeat against Italy in a thrilling Six Nations game.

entries.title: Tottenham Hotspur 1-0 Manchester City: Harry Kane passes Jimmy Greaves as Spurs' all-time top scorer
entries.description: Harry Kane becomes Tottenham's all-time record scorer, surpassing the great Jimmy Greaves, as his 267th goal for the club dents Manchester City's title ambitions at a raucous Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

entries.title: China balloon: US searches in Atlantic for wreckage
entries.description: The US is trying recover debris from the suspected spy balloon that fell in shallow waters off South Carolina.

entries.title: Watch: Hearts' Stephen Humphrys scores stunner from own half against Dundee Utd
entries.description: Watch Hearts' Stephen Humphrys score a remarkable goal from his own half to seal a 3-1 Scottish Premiership victory over Dundee United.

entries.title: Italy 24-29 France: Six Nations champions avoid shock defeat
entries.description: Defending champions France come from behind to avoid a shock defeat against Italy in a thrilling Six Nations game in Rome.

entries.title: Harry Kane: Tottenham striker overtakes Jimmy Greaves as Spurs' all-time top scorer
entries.description: Harry Kane moves ahead of Jimmy Greaves to become Tottenham's all-time top goalscorer with his 267th goal for the club.

entries.title: How NHS strikes on Monday 6 February will affect you
entries.description: What you need to know about strikes by nurses and ambulance workers by the BBC's Zoe Conway.

entries.title: New images show Nicola Bulley on day she disappeared
entries.description: Nicola Bulley is seen loading her car before taking her children to school on the day she disappeared.

entries.title: Nottingham Forest 1-0 Leeds United: Brennan Johnson strike raises pressure on Jesse Marsch
entries.description: Brennan Johnson scores the only goal as Nottingham Forest beat Leeds to move six points clear of the Premier League relegation places.

entries.title: IBSF World Championships 2023: Great Britain win joint silver in four-man bobsleigh
entries.description: Brad Hall, Taylor Lawrence, Greg Cackett and Arran Gulliver finish joint second to claim Britain's first four-man medal at the World Championships since 1939.

entries.title: Tottenham Hotspur 2-3 Chelsea: Lauren James scores superb strike as Blues move top of WSL
entries.description: Chelsea move back to the top of the Women's Super League and extend their unbeaten run to 19 games in all competitions by beating Tottenham at Brisbane Road.

entries.title: Weekend avalanches kill 10 in Austria and Switzerland
entries.description: Officials in western Austria warned winter sports enthusiasts of dangerous conditions in the area.

entries.title: St Johnstone 1-4 Celtic: Champions restore nine-point lead in Scottish Premiership
entries.description: Celtic "won't put a ceiling on what they can achieve" after restoring their nine-point Scottish Premiership lead with a routine win at St Johnstone.

entries.title: Iran protests: Protesters among prisoners pardoned by leader
entries.description: Iranians involved in anti-government demos are among those set to be released.

entries.title: Bradford: Plans for 'Brit School North' proposed
entries.description: The Brit School in Croydon has nurtured a host of international music stars, including Adele.

entries.title: Truss's tax cuts clearly wrong approach, says Shapps
entries.description: Grant Shapps, who briefly served in Liz Truss's cabinet, said inflation must fall before taxes are cut.

entries.title: Situation in east Ukraine getting tougher, says Zelensky
entries.description: Ukrainian troops in the Donetsk region are facing difficult conditions, the country's president says.

entries.title: Balloon saga deflates efforts to mend US-China relations
entries.description: Concerns about the balloon have derailed a vital visit to China this week by the US's top diplomat.

entries.title: Vile speculation hurtful to Nicola Bulley's family, friend says
entries.description: Nicola Bulley’s friend says speculation online is hurtful as police condemn social media abuse.

entries.title: Matt Dawson column: Steve Borthwick has boxed himself in with Owen Farrell
entries.description: Ex-England captain Matt Dawson explains why new head coach Steve Borthwick is in a bind with captain Owen Farrell.

entries.title: Six Nations: Scotland's bits and pieces cause Calcutta Cup sensation
entries.description: Tom English reflects on an exceptional Calcutta Cup victory for Scotland over England at Twickenham in the Six Nations opening weekend.

entries.title: Union boss Sharon Graham calls on Sunak to intervene on NHS pay
entries.description: Sharon Graham urged the PM to break the deadlock ahead of the biggest week of strikes in NHS history.

entries.title: How beavers are reviving wetlands
entries.description: Wetlands are being lost at a faster rate than forests, but in some regions beavers are part of the solution.

entries.title: Dad completes charity run along entire length of M1
entries.description: Jamie Austin finishes the last leg of his challenge after setting off from Leeds 10 days ago.

entries.title: Amanda Serrano sets up Katie Taylor rematch in Dublin with win over Erika Cruz
entries.description: Amanda Serrano beats Erika Cruz to become undisputed featherweight champion and set up a rematch with Katie Taylor.

entries.title: Pervez Musharraf, Pakistan's ex-president, dies aged 79
entries.description: The former president, who seized power in a coup in 1999, survived numerous assassination attempts.

entries.title: Obituary: Pervez Musharraf
entries.description: Pakistan's military ruler found himself on the front line between militant Islamists and the West.

entries.title: ‘We want our murals to show that there’s hope’
entries.description: Two artists from County Antrim are painting murals to raises awareness of mental health issues.

entries.title: Hanif Kureishi says life 'completely changed' after collapse
entries.description: The My Beautiful Launderette author said losing the use of his limbs had been "illuminating as well as terrible".

entries.title: Farewell radiators? Testing out electric infrared wallpaper
entries.description: Pilots are being run around the UK to see if electric wallpaper could be an efficient way to heat homes.

entries.title: The papers: Truss 'never given a chance' and 'zero chance' of meeting hospital pledge
entries.description: Liz Truss's first account of her time as PM and questions over new hospitals being built lead the front pages.

entries.title: Wealthy UK family to apologise in Grenada over slave-owning past
entries.description: The Trevelyan family, who owned more than 1,000 African slaves in the 19th Century, will also pay reparations.

entries.title: Truss: I was never given realistic chance to cut taxes
entries.description: The ex-PM's comments are the first detailed remarks she has made since she was forced out of No 10.

entries.title: Constance Marten: Missing couple and baby thought to be camping in Sussex
entries.description: Police say their concern over the whereabouts of the couple and their newborn 'continues to grow'.

entries.title: Israel protests: Tens of thousands in anti-government rally
entries.description: It's the fifth week of mass protests across Israel over government plans to curb the judiciary's powers.

entries.title: Happy Valley: What's life really like living on Sgt Cawood's beat?
entries.description: The hit TV series has left its mark on those living on the fictional beat of Sgt Catherine Cawood.

entries.title: Jasvir Singh: 'I'm a devout Sikh - and married to a man'
entries.description: Jasvir Singh is a prominent Sikh voice in the UK. He is also gay, and sees no conflict between his sexuality and religion.

entries.title: Turkey elections: Biggest test for Erdogan amid cost of living crisis
entries.description: Rampant inflation is a key issue for voters as Turkey’s President Erdogan faces elections in May.

entries.title: Grammy Awards 2023: How to watch and who will win
entries.description: Adele, Beyoncé, Kendrick Lamar and Harry Styles are up for prizes at the 65th annual Grammys in LA.

entries.title: How to cook Spanish tortilla: Salmonella outbreak sparks national debate
entries.description: A bout of food poisoning at a Madrid restaurant stirs debate about how to cook a Spanish tortilla.

entries.title: Andrew Tate: Inside the Romanian town where brothers' empire began
entries.description: "Arrogant", "discreet" - Lucy Williamson visits the apartment block where the brothers first settled.

entries.title: 'Now I deliver food, but once I played football for my country'
entries.description: Poulami Adhikari played in India's under-16 team, but had to stop when her family fell on hard times.

entries.title: Energy firms given Tuesday deadline for prepayment meter action
entries.description: Business Secretary Grant Shapps said energy firms need to refocus their efforts on customers who had prepayment meters forcibly installed
